stories.text: Our grads in our firm earn 140k and aren't expected to know much, they leave after a year or two. Basically I'd like to break into a new company and role and I'd be better than any grad and stick around. I dont need a formal grad program, I dont mind getting a pay cut, I just want to start again. Is it really impossible?
stories.title: How to get a grad-level job in your 40s
It's ok if you started programming at 8 or at 38. You can still get out. Run

stories.text: Hello all! I am looking for ideas to start a side hustle and gain some more experience in software engineering ad well as some extra income. If it is something which has to do with open source. I have up to $20k dollars as initial capital if needed.
stories.title: Can you contribute side hustle idea?
